title: Use of math.h's abs() for doubles

content.html:
In the DRCVehiclePlugin (and maybe also in other code) you're using the c version of abs() to get the absolute value of doubles which causes them to get cut off. Either use <cmath> (which uses overloads of abs() for doubles) instead of <math.h> or fabs().

This causes wrong max velocity caps (FYI: your current velocity max is way too high, for the VRC/DRC in drive mode low it's 4.44 or 4.47 depending on whether you use kph or mph for conversion) and possibly also wrong tire angle ranges.

Two occurrences in DRCVehiclePlugin:

#!/osrf/drcsim/src/45a23d87af80af8bbc467a58382dba903f8572d7/plugins/DRCVehiclePlugin.cc?at=default#cl-207

#!/osrf/drcsim/src/45a23d87af80af8bbc467a58382dba903f8572d7/plugins/DRCVehiclePlugin.cc?at=default#cl-547
